main event: The report contains sightings of unidentified aerial objects over Japan on April 27, 1950 and May 5, 1950, as recorded in an Air Intelligence Information Report from Project Blue Book.
interesting points: The sightings describe pilots observing a large, disc-shaped, silver object traveling at tremendous speeds and displaying erratic flight behavior.
The pilots were unable to identify the objects or determine any apparent means of propulsion, exhaust, or control surfaces.

The report speculates that the sightings may have been caused by visual effects produced by shock waves from other USAF aircraft, resulting in distorted light signals and varying colors and pulsing effects.

Additionally, there are reports of 'flying saucers' streaking through the skies over Sydney, Australia, with observers describing the objects as larger than a plane, traveling at great speed, and making a flash across the sky shortly after dusk.
Officials could not explain the phenomenon, and even the Royal Australian Air Force confirmed there were no jet planes on duty near Sydney at the time of the sightings.
sighted object: unidentified aerial objects, disc-shaped, silver in color
witnesses: pilots, air force officers, and civilian observers
photographs: no photographs provided in the report
